data.name: JobAdvert1Html
data.value:
Ceremonies Hosts (CET01739)

Job Reference:

CET01739

Location:

Lewes

Organisation:

East Sussex County Council

Department:

Communities, Economy and Transport

Contract Type:

Casual

Job Type:

Customer Services

Salary:

14981  - 15507  GBP  Year

Closing Date:

29/01/2017
Job Details

Hours of work: Casual hours
Working pattern: Part-time

Closing date: Sunday 29 January 2017

For an informal discussion, please contact Pamela Day on 01273 337035 / 07876 036872.
About the Role

The East Sussex Registration Service is seeking self-motivated individuals to join its ceremony team at our newly refurbished Southover Grange Register Office in Lewes.

If you have good communication skills, a can do attitude, the ability to work under pressure, and excellent interpersonal skills you could be the person we are looking for. Full training will be provided.

You will be responsible for assisting with the meeting and greeting of couples and their guests. You will be required to ensure that all guests are ushered into the correct room at the right time. To prepare the rooms both pre and post bookings and ensure all guests requirements are met with regard to refreshments etc. Compliance with the licensing laws and the ability to assert yourself when necessary are required along with assisting to help maintain the security of the building.

You will also need to demonstrate a sensitive approach to working with people and be smartly dressed as appropriate for the role.

Whilst many of our ceremonies take place at weekends, and on public holidays, some couples choose to have their ceremony on a weekday. We cannot guarantee hours of work on particular days or on a regular basis but you would need to be available for work at weekends/public holidays especially during the summer months during which time we would expect you to work most weekends as required by the needs of the service. Occasional evening work may also be required.
Additional Information

Your starting salary will be pro rata if the above position is part-time or term-time only.

Work Permits: we may be able to obtain a Work Permit for this post but this is subject to meeting the requirements of the UK Border Agency’s Points-based Immigration System.

From 6 April 2011 the Home Office has placed a permanent restriction on the number of migrant workers that all Tier 2 (General) Sponsors can recruit. Due to the restrictions we cannot guarantee that individuals that meet the requirements of the Points-based Immigration System will be issued with clearance to obtain work permits.
Equal Opportunities

East Sussex County Council is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitable candidates, regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, disability or age. All applications are treated on merit.
How to apply

Information for redeployees

If you wish to discuss the above position in more detail or be considered for redeployment into this post, please contact your HR Advisor.
Available documents

{"Url":"https://www.example.org/56070/CSD01592/instrumental-and-vocal-teacher/countywide","JobTitle":"Instrumental and Vocal Teacher","Organisation":"East Sussex County Council","Location":"Countywide","Salary":{"MinimumSalary":16461,"MaximumSalary":33160,"SalaryRange":"£16,461 to £33,160 per annum","SearchRange":"Teachers' Pay Scale"},"ClosingDate":"2018-04-01T00:00:00+01:00","Id":56070,"Reference":"CSD01592","AdditionalInformationHtml":"

This post is subject to an Enhanced DBS check or Enhanced check for Regulated Activity with the Disclosure & Barring Services (previously the Criminal Records Bureau). For further information about what is required in this process please go to www.gov.uk/disclosure-barring-service-check. Please note that we require evidence of an overseas police check if you have lived or worked abroad.

Your starting salary will be pro rata if the above position is part-time or term-time only.

Work Permits: we may be able to obtain a Work Permit for this post but this is subject to meeting the requirements of the UK Border Agency’s Points-based Immigration System.

From 6 April 2011 the Home Office has placed a permanent restriction on the number of migrant workers that all Tier 2 (General) Sponsors can recruit. Due to the restrictions we cannot guarantee that individuals that meet the requirements of the Points-based Immigration System will be issued with clearance to obtain work permits.

Information for redeployees

If you wish to discuss the above position in more detail or be considered for redeployment into this post, please contact your HR Advisor.

","EqualOpportunitiesHtml":"

East Sussex County Council is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome applications from all suitable candidates, regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, disability or age. All applications are treated on merit.

","AdvertHtml":"

Hours of work: Variable

Working pattern: Casual, Term-time only

Interviews are held periodically as demand arises. Please submit your application online at any time and if you are shortlisted we will contact you when a vacancy arises.

For an informal discussion, please contact Karen Koflach on 01273 336786.

About the Role

East Sussex Music is the local authority music service for East Sussex, and lead organisation of the East Sussex Music Education Hub. For the last 80 years our staff of around 70 full and part time teachers have been delivering outstanding music education to pupils, families and schools across the county. We deliver individual, small group and whole class lessons to pupils aged 5 - 18. We coach over 100 ensembles at our weekly area music centres, have a number of county level groups of a high standard, including the East Sussex Youth Orchestra and run an annual summer school for young musicians at all levels.

We are seeking innovative and creative instrumental and vocal teachers to join our panel to meet increasing demand from schools. Candidates will have achieved at least diploma level on their main instrument and be able to teach in groups including, where appropriate, multiple instruments within their specialism and whole class programmes in primary schools.

East Sussex Music offers its teachers a range of opportunities teaching in school, after-school and at Saturday music centres. We are committed to developing the skills and career opportunities for our staff through regular CPD sessions and opportunities to participate in our range of projects and programmes during the year with the support of our experienced teaching and leadership team.

Available documents

  • Job Description and Person Specification

data.name: SalaryInBodyText2
data.value:
QUALITY OFFICER

£16,692 - £17,808 per annum (Full-time/full year).

We are looking for a well-qualified, enthusiastic team player with excellent communication, administration and IT skills.  Key elements of this role will be managing the administration of the College’s quality management systems, preparing reports, setting up online surveys and other quality measures; and providing an analysis of the results.  You will need to have excellent communications skills and be effective in working with people across the organisation at all levels as well as having a sharp eye for detail and be meticulously organised.

Closing date:   Monday 30 January 2017 (by noon).

St Leonards on Sea
East Sussex
TN38 9PB

Phone: 01424 852326
Email: academyadmin@churchwoodprimaryacademy.org.uk
Website: www.churchwoodprimaryacademy.org.uk

Please note, we do not accept CVs.

This post is covered by the Childcare Disqualification Regulations 2009. 

The school will need to ensure that they are not knowingly employing a person who is disqualified under the 2009 Regulations in connection with relevant childcare provision.  Accordingly, the successful candidate will be required to demonstrate to the school, by completing a self-declaration form as part of the pre-employment checks process, that they have not been disqualified under the 2009 Regulations. 

If the preferred candidate is found to be disqualified under the 2009 Regulations, the offer of employment will be subject to the application by the preferred candidate to Ofsted for a waiver and the receipt of a waiver from Ofsted.

data.name: WorkPatternInBodyText9
data.value:
Job Details

Hours of work: teacher full time hours

Closing date: March 31 2017 at 12 noon - Applications will be considered upon receipt.

For more information and to apply for the above post, please contact:

Hawkes Farm Academy
Hawkes Road
Hailsham
East Sussex
BN27 1ND

Phone: 01323 841366
Email: ssantos@hawkesfarmacademy.org
Website:  www.hawkesfarmacademy.org

Please note, we do not accept CVs.
About the Role

PASSION – URGENCY- POSITIVITY- ASPIRATION - COMMITMENT

We are looking to appoint talented Newly Qualified Teachers to join our strong and committed team in September 2017. This is an exciting time for practitioners who want to take the next step in their career. Hawkes Farm Academy is a dynamic school with an excellent community feel and we are looking for inspirational teachers.

The successful candidates will be
•     Motivational
•     Positive
•     Inspiring
•     Visionary
•     Ambitious

In return Hawkes Farm and STEP Academy Trust can offer you:
•     An excellent NQT programme.
•     Inquisitive, enthusiastic and engaged children who are eager to learn.
•    An extremely friendly and strong supportive staff team.
•    The opportunity to make a significant difference in many aspects of school life.
•     A free lunch each day, freshly prepared in house.
•    Pay rises above those that are nationally awarded.
•    Excellent opportunities for career progression.
•     An exciting curriculum which staff shape for the future.

This post is covered by the Childcare Disqualification Regulations 2009. 

The school will need to ensure that they are not knowingly employing a person who is disqualified under the 2009 Regulations in connection with relevant childcare provision.  Accordingly, the successful candidate will be required to demonstrate to the school, by completing a self-declaration form as part of the pre-employment checks process, that they have not been disqualified under the 2009 Regulations. 

If the preferred candidate is found to be disqualified under the 2009 Regulations, the offer of employment will be subject to the application by the preferred candidate to Ofsted for a waiver and the receipt of a waiver from Ofsted. 


Visits to Hawkes Farm are actively encouraged. To arrange either a visit, or for more information about the role, please contact our Academy Business Manager, Susan Santos, via email: ssantos@hawkesfarmacademy.org Completed application forms should be returned to the same email.

Interviews: Will be arranged upon receipt of applications that are shortlisted for interview.

To apply please complete the application form (available from the websites below) with a supporting statement and send to Susan Santos at the above email address or to Hawkes Farm Academy, Hawks Road, Hailsham, East Sussex, BN27 1ND

Please also take a look at the Hawkes Farm and STEP Academy websites for further information on the Academy and Trust:
http://hawkesfarmacademy.org/
http://www.stepacademytrust.org/

STEP Academy Trust believes that its workforce should reflect the local community and that all groups within the community should have equal access to the Trust’s employment opportunities. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
STEP Academy Trust is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and we expect all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.
This post is subject to a satisfactory Enhanced DBS Check and references.


 

    
Additional Information

Work Permits: we may be able to obtain a Work Permit for this post but this is subject to meeting the requirements of the UK Border Agency’s Points-based Immigration System.

From 6 April 2011 the Home Office has placed a permanent restriction on the number of migrant workers that all Tier 2 (General) Sponsors can recruit. Due to the restrictions we cannot guarantee that individuals that meet the requirements of the Points-based Immigration System will be issued with clearance to obtain work permits.

The Academy is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. All staff will be expected to hold or be willing to obtain an enhanced DBS check or Enhanced check for Regulated Activity with the Disclosure & Barring Services (previously the Criminal Records Bureau).

For further information about what is required in this process please go to www.gov.uk/disclosure-barring-service-check.
